body_html: FYI I've been able to compile everything (without testing python bindings, and using AVX, not AVX2), see #14801. However I've discovered that despite everything ran fine, the VS2017 (until 15.4) distribution introduced a bug in the /WHOLEARCHIVE trick resulting in unfilled factories (session, device...) as mentioned in. Therefore I am stuck using vs2017 for linking my application with TF. @aluo-x
body_text: FYI I've been able to compile everything (without testing python bindings, and using AVX, not AVX2), see #14801. However I've discovered that despite everything ran fine, the VS2017 (until 15.4) distribution introduced a bug in the /WHOLEARCHIVE trick resulting in unfilled factories (session, device...) as mentioned in. Therefore I am stuck using vs2017 for linking my application with TF. @aluo-x
body: FYI I've been able to compile everything (without testing python bindings, and using AVX, not AVX2), see #14801. However I've discovered that despite everything ran fine, the VS2017 (until 15.4) distribution introduced a bug in the /WHOLEARCHIVE trick resulting in unfilled factories (session, device...) [as mentioned in](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/132766/wholearchive-linker-flag-is-dysfunctional-since-15.html). Therefore I am stuck using vs2017 for linking my application with TF. @aluo-x
